contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=March 2013}} [[File:Governor Reuben Chapman.jpg|thumb|Reuben Chapman]] '''Reuben Chapman''' (July 15, 1799 – May 16, 1882) was an [[United States|American]] lawyer and politician. Born in 1799 in [[Bowling Green, Virginia]], he represented [[Alabama]] in the [[United States House of Representatives|U.S. House]] from 1835 to 1847 and served as the [[List of Governors of Alabama|13th]] [[Governor of Alabama|Governor]] of the [[U.S. state]] of [[Alabama]] from 1847 to 1849. He died in [[Huntsville, Alabama]] in 1882. ==External links== *[http://bioguide.congress.gov/scripts/biodisplay.pl?index=C000316 Biographic sketch at U.S. Congress website] *[http://www.archives.state.al.us/govs_list/g_chapma.html Alabama Department of Archives and History] {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{succession box | before = [[Joshua L. Martin]] |title=[[List of Governors of Alabama|Governor of Alabama]] | years = 1847—1849 | after = [[Henry W. Collier]]}} {{s-end}} {{Governors of Alabama}} {{Authority control|VIAF=121814367}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Chapman, Reuben | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = July 15, 1799 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = May 16, 1882 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chapman, Reuben}} [[Category:1799 births]] [[Category:1882 deaths]] [[Category:People from Caroline County, Virginia]] [[Category:Members of the United States House of Representatives from Alabama]] [[Category:Governors of Alabama]] [[Category:Alabama Democrats]] [[Category:Alabama Jacksonians]] [[Category:Democratic Party state governors of the United States]] {{Alabama-politician-stub}}
